description.narrative: DCPSF är en givarfond som hanteras av UNDP. Fondens strategi är att stödja projekt på gräsrotsnivå som arbetar med de grundläggande orsakerna till konflikterna på lokal nivå i Darfur. Detta gjordes tidigare med syftet att komplettera övergripande fredsprocesser, men detta syfte har i praktiken ersatts med det förväntade resultatet: "Stärkt förmåga att genom lokala fredsinitiativ förebygga konflikter och åstadkomma försoning i Darfur". Projekten under DCPSF pågår parallellt med pågående humanitära insatser, där samverkan främst sker genom koordering och utbyte av information om läget i Darfur. DCPSF utgör ett av de få program som stödjer fredsbyggande på lokal nivå i Darfur.

Darfur Community and Peace Building Fund (DCPSF), phase 2 (2011-2020). A community driven peace and reconciliation initiative. UNDP administers the fund which aims to foster dialogue and funding of small scale peace building initiatives at community level. The support is a second tranche for phase 2, in line with the Results Strategy for Sudan, 2014-2017.

description.narrative: In 2018, the Darfur Community Peace and Stability Fund (DCPSF) supported 18 partner organisations in implementing projects across the five Darfur states. Under Output 1, 144 Community-based Reconciliation Mechanisms (CBRMs) were supported, with a reported 84.3 % success rate (85 % in 2017). In the latest annual perception survey, 96.2 % of the respondents reported to have access to a CBRM, and 90.7 % reportedly had trust in the CBRMs to solve inter- and intra-community related disputes. However, only 64.3 % of respondents indicated a general satisfaction with the CBRMs. The Technical Secretariat of the DCPSF partly attributes this low figure to a general dissatisfaction with living conditions, and issues sometimes beyond the control of the DCPSF, such as long-standing problems related to land ownership. Under Output 2, DCPSF's partners conducted 368 peace dividend activities, reaching 21,775 individuals (66 % female). Peace dividens carried out includes demarcation of migratory routes, construction of marketplaces, and the establishment of village savings and loans associations (VSLAs). Output 3 results mainly revolved around the process of drafting a new ToR and identifying and procuring a suitable partner to implement the Gender and Peacebuilding Initiative (GPI). The process was finalized in late 2018, where a first phase of research that commenced in December 2018, was aimed at designing the GPI. Due to the political turmoil in Sudan in 2019 as well as internal challanges with the implementing partner (CARE), the finalization of the GPI has been delayed to February 2020. Under Output 4, 48 local civil society organizations were supported through capacity building activities. In addition, several peace conferences with community leaders and local authority staff, including the Humanitarian Aid Commission (HAC), were held. In 2019, the Embassy attended all four Steering Committee meetings, and conducted a joint donor field visit to South Darfur in November. In 2018, the Embassy attended 2 of a total 4 Steering Committee meetings. No field visits were undertaken in 2018.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
